title: Old French Vogue Slab Serif
content:
Looking for an ID on this one.  
Thanks!

| --- | --- |

 [‹ Whacky hand-drawn style](http://web.archive.org/web/20090406030218/http:/typophile.com/node/56623 "Go to previous forum topic") [Arial-type font - obscure or possibly customized ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090406030218/http:/typophile.com/node/56629 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Mario

comments.content:
Looks very close to Memphis Bold, though this does seem slightly bolder, and the round tittle of the “i” diverges from the available versions. How old is the source: could it be pre-digital?  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/memphis/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090406030218/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/memphis/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/memphis/")
It’s not that old, from around 2002.

Oh :-) Well, my money would be on a slightly customized Memphis  
(artificially boldened and with a customized tittle).  
But maybe someone else has a better idea?
